content.user_title: Work with NeonDB Postgres using Drizzle ORM
content.value_statement: This skill provides documentation and guidance for interacting with NeonDB serverless Postgres database using Drizzle ORM. It covers connection setup, schema definitions, CRUD operations, and migrations for database-driven applications.
actual_capabilities: Connect to NeonDB serverless Postgres using Drizzle ORM
Define and manage database schemas with Drizzle
Execute CRUD operations (select, insert, update, delete)
Run database migrations with Drizzle Kit
Set up authentication tables (users, sessions, accounts)
limitations: Does not install dependencies or configure environment
Requires manual setup of DATABASE_URL environment variable
Does not handle connection pooling or transaction management

output_examples.input: How do I insert a new user record?
output: Use db.insert() with your table definition
Make sure to import your schema and the db connection from your database index file
The values object should match your schema column definitions

best_practices: Always use environment variables for database connection strings
Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection
Run migrations in production before deploying application updates
Keep schema definitions in separate files for better organization
anti_patterns: Using raw SQL when Drizzle ORM abstractions are available
Not handling database connection errors in production

faq.question: Which database drivers does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on NeonDB serverless Postgres using @neondatabase/serverless driver with Drizzle ORM.

faq.question: What are the connection limits for NeonDB?
faq.answer: NeonDB has connection limits based on your plan. Use connection pooling for serverless environments.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing project?
faq.answer: Install drizzle-orm and @neondatabase/serverless, set DATABASE_URL env var, and import db from your index file.

faq.question: Is my data safe with NeonDB?
faq.answer: NeonDB provides automated backups and encryption. Use environment variables for credentials and follow security best practices.

faq.question: Why is my migration failing?
faq.answer: Check that DATABASE_URL is set, ensure you have migration permissions, and verify your schema syntax before running migrations.

faq.question: How does this compare to Prisma or TypeORM?
faq.answer: Drizzle ORM is lighter and closer to raw SQL. It offers better type safety and faster cold starts for serverless environments.
